content: shetland lace cowl shetland lace cowl luba chambers luba@woolchambers com au page 1 of 5 designed by luba chambers luba@woolchambers com au skills needed provisional or judy s magic cast on optional kitchener stitch optional lace knitting reading a lace chart sizes one size length and width can be adjusted by knitting more or less pattern repeats finished length 120cm / 47 ¼ inches finished width 30cm / 11 ¾ inches materials lotus yarns cashmere fingering 2oz/55g 399yd/365m 100% mongolian cashmere one skein fingering weight yarn #01 white yarn substitution this pattern can be knitted with almost any yarn a lace fingering or sock weight yarn is recommended 3 5mm us 4 needles or size needed to obtain desired gauge stitch markers stitch holder or waste yarn gauge sample was knit with 23sts and 32 row = 10 cm 4 in garter stitch after blocking gauge is not critical in this pattern note on adjusting cowl width this cowl can be made wider or narrower example in photo uses four pattern repeats as shown on chart each repeat is eight stitches to adjust cowl width add or subtract multiples of eight stitches the stitch repeat is shown in brackets pattern notes the cowl is worked over a background of garter stitch a provisional cast on is used alternatively judy s magic cast on may be used if preferred if using judy s magic cast on one set of stitches is placed on a stitch holder the cowl is then worked using the other set of stitches work is joined into a circle using kitchener stitch after the knitting is complete *if you prefer not to use a provisional or judy s magic cast on cowl can be knitted using your preferred cast on and bind off method and then seamed together shetland lace cowl luba chambers luba@woolchambers com au page 2 of 5 cowl using provisional cast on cast on 55sts if using judy s magic cast on cast on 55sts on each needle and move one set of stitches to holder begin working shetland cowl chart place markers for borders and stitch repeats repeat row 1-20 eighteen times or to one less repeat than desired length repeat row 1-19 once if you are not using a provisional or judy s magic cast on bind off all sts joining if using provisional cast on remove the scrap yarn and place live sts on a knitting needle if using judy s magic cast on move stitches from holder to knitting needle with ws facing using kitchener stitch join the first row and last row knitted if not using a provisional or judy s magic cast on seam the cast on and bind off row finishing block weave in ends abbreviations k knit k2tog knit two together rs right side s slip ssk slip slip knit slip two stitches one at a time as if to knit insert left needle into these stitches and knit them together st stitch sts stitches ws
